comments:
Build ID: M20070921-1145

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Ive used in local network Eclipse via proxy
2.I removed proxy due i was on direct internet connection
3.Eclipse is still using the same proxy


More information:
I tried to update SVN and it shows this error (xxxxx is the projects name and yyyyy is the proxy server adress)

org.tigris.subversion.svnclientadapter.SVNClientException: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: RA layer request failed
svn: PROPFIND request failed on '/dev-svn'
svn: PROPFIND of '/dev-svn': Could not resolve hostname `yyyyy': No such host is known.   (https://xxxxx.com)

	at org.tigris.subversion.svnclientadapter.javahl.AbstractJhlClientAdapter.update(AbstractJhlClientAdapter.java:824)
	at org.tigris.subversion.subclipse.core.commands.UpdateResourcesCommand.run(UpdateResourcesCommand.java:65)
	at org.tigris.subversion.subclipse.ui.operations.UpdateOperation.execute(UpdateOperation.java:63)
	at org.tigris.subversion.subclipse.ui.operations.RepositoryProviderOperation.execute(RepositoryProviderOperation.java:68)
	at org.tigris.subversion.subclipse.ui.operations.SVNOperation.run(SVNOperation.java:90)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.JobRunnableContext.run(JobRunnableContext.java:144)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.actions.JobRunnableContext$ResourceJob.runInWorkspace(JobRunnableContext.java:72)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:38)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
Caused by: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: RA layer request failed
svn: PROPFIND request failed on '/dev-svn'
svn: PROPFIND of '/dev-svn': Could not resolve hostname `yyyyy': No such host is known.   (https://xxxxx.com)

	at org.tigris.subversion.javahl.SVNClient.update(Native Method)
	at org.tigris.subversion.javahl.SVNClient.update(SVNClient.java:366)
	at org.tigris.subversion.svnclientadapter.javahl.AbstractJhlClientAdapter.update(AbstractJhlClientAdapter.java:821)
	... 8 more

I did the same thing with CVS repository provider and I didn't get the error like yours. The strange thing is that, even if I hadn't removed the invalid proxy address, I still wasn't hit be the error. I haven't looked at the code, but it's possible that CVS client ignores the invalid proxy address and tries to connect directly. But I'm not 100% sure about that (not even 50% :)

Aiki, have you asked guys from Subclipse about that? Have you tried restarting the Eclipse?

Given that Subclipse uses third party libraries to connect to an SVN repository, there is a good chance that proxies that are specified in Eclipse are not used. Aiki, perhaps you could ask this question on a Subclipse newsgroup or mailing list to see if others have encountered similar problems.

Please. Close this buf report. Ive checke twice my registry and there was in some other part hidden the Tigris SVN keys which looked like exact copies of the one ive deleted already. Thanks alot for help. I suggest when somebody has similar issue to check the registry for the proxy name string and erase it manualy. SVN will not remove them. Bye Byu
